DOC.brief_summary: The purpose study determine whether transarterial supraselective embolization ( TSE ) technique effective transurethral resection prostate ( TURP ) treatment low urinary tract symptom associate benign prostatic hyperplasia ( BPH ) .
DOC.brief_title: Clinical Trial Evaluate Efficacy Safety Transarterial Supraselective Embolization Prostate Treat Urinary Symptoms .
DOC.criteria: Diagnosis benign prostatic hyperplasia moderate severe obstructive low urinary tract symptom Refractory medical treatment least 6 month Qmax ( maximum urinary flow ) less 10 mL/second Patients candidate transurethral resection prostate ( TURP ) Advanced atherosclerosis tortuosity iliac arteries No visualization prostatic artery CT angiography study Urethral stenosis , detrusor failure neurogenic bladder Glomerular filtration < 30 mL/min Presence malignant tumor History allergy iodinate contrast Patients medical social condition , deem Investigator likely interfere patient 's ability sign inform consent , cooperate participate study , interfere interpretation result
